intro: Daphne shillong, commonly known as Shillong daphne, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its compact shrub form with dense, aromatic foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, depending on the variety. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at higher altitudes. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
